info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 12 at 3:13PM PDT until April 14 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 11 AM PDT THURSDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 inches at lower elevations to up 9 inches at higher elevations. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County including Mount Shasta City. * WHEN...From noon Wednesday to 11 AM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult during periods of heavier snow showers and at higher elevations. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute on Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are likely to be around 4000 feet Wednesday afternoon and then lower to near 3000 feet Thursday morning. The heaviest snowfall is likely to fall Wednesday night. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
